coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1GettingStarted-Hint: Essential settings to get started with Coffee Pub Blacksmith
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH4Introduction-Hint: The Blacksmith Module serves as the foundational framework for the entire Coffee Pub module series, providing essential services and shared functionality that all other modules depend upon. While powerful as a standalone module with features like enhanced combat statistics, customizable UI elements, and comprehensive token management, its true potential is realized when integrated with the complete Coffee Pub suite, where it orchestrates seamless communication and synchronization between all modules.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2CoffeePubSuite-Hint: Information about installed Coffee Pub modules
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2DefaultPartySettings-Hint: Default settings for party creation and management
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultPartyName-Hint: The default party name to use when creating new narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultPartySize-Hint: The default party size to use when creating new narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultPartyMakeup-Hint: The default party makeup to use when creating new narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultPartyLevel-Hint: The default party level to use when creating new narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultRulebooks-Hint: A comma separated list of default rule books to use when creating new narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2CampaignSettings-Hint: These are used as context for various tools and features, including both any AI generated content as well as augment any JSON imports for items, journal entries, characters, etc.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3CampaignCommon-Hint: General campaign settings that are common to all narratives.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3CampaignGeography-Hint: The geography of the campaign. This includes the location, parent, environment, and area. These will be used as context for whenever location information is needed. Geography hierarchy: REALM > REGION > SITE > AREA.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultCampaignRealm-Hint: The broad world or plane of existence, encompassing vast continents, cultures, and histories (e.g. Faer√ªn, Eberron, etc.).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultCampaignRegion-Hint: A defined area within a realm, such as a kingdom, territory, or geographic expanse.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultCampaignSite-Hint: A specific location or structure within a region like a building, mine, or stronghold.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultCampaignArea-Hint: A distinct part of a site like a room, chamber, street, or locartion where scenes or encounters occur.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1LayoutAndExperience-Hint: Customize the layout and experience of the Coffee Pub suite of modules.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2Themes-Hint: Enable or disable the themes you'd like made available in the Coffee Pub suite of modules.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultCardTheme-Hint: This theme will be used as the default theme unless you override it in the other coffee pub modules.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2FoundryEnhancements-Hint: Enhancements and improvements to FoundryVTT's interface and functionality
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3QualityOfLife-Hint: Quality of life improvements and user experience enhancements
coffee-pub-blacksmith.coreLoadingProgress-Hint: Show a loading progress indicator during FoundryVTT world loading making it clear when the cleitn is fully loaded and ready to use.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.objectLinkStyle-Hint: Styling for object links in chat and journals
coffee-pub-blacksmith.canvasToolsHideLeftUI-Hint: When enabled, the left side of the interface, including the branding, toolbar, and player list will be hidden when the toggle is activated. Be warned, if other modules have added items to this area, they will also be hidden.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.canvasToolsHideBottomUI-Hint: When enabled, the bottom of the interface, including the macrobar, will be hidden when the toggle is activated. Be warned, if other modules have added items to this area, they will also be hidden.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.sidebarStyleUI-Hint: When enabled, applies custom styling to the sidebar including rounded corners, background colors, and improved spacing.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.sidebarPinUI-Hint: When enabled, the sidebar will be pinned in place when the toggle is activated.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.sidebarManualRollsEnabled-Hint: A button will be added to the sidebar that will allow you to toggle manual rolls for all dice. For this to work, you must go into foundry's Dice Configuration settings in CORE at least once and enable manual rolls for one of the dice. This will instantiate the dice settings and allow us to toggle the whole set.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.sidebarManualRollsPlayersEnabled-Hint: Allow players to enable the manual rolls button.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.sidebarCombatChatEnabled-Hint: Add a tab that will combine the combat and chat tabs into a single tab. This is useful for players to see the combat and chat log in one place.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3menubar-Hint: Settings for the menubar that appears at the top of foundry's interface.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableMenubar-Hint: Show the slim Blacksmith Menubar at the top of the foundry interface. Required for many of the tools and features of blacksmit including combat enhancements.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.excludedUsersMenubar-Hint: List of userIDs that should not see the menubar. (comma-separated)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.toolbarDisplayStyle-Hint: Choose how to display category organization in the toolbar: Foundry Default (no organization), Category Dividers (visual separators), or Category Labels (text labels).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableSceneInteractions-Hint: Adds icons to the scene title letting you know which is active and which is being viewed. Defualt: Enabled (checked).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableSceneClickBehaviors-Hint: Change the default mouse behaviors on the Scene Directory. Left-click: View Scene, Double-click: Activate Scene, and Shift-Left-click: Open up the scene configuration window. Defualt: Enabled (checked).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.hideRollTableIcon-Hint: Hide the roll table icon in the interface
coffee-pub-blacksmith.chatSpacing-Hint: Gap between chat messages. Applies globally to all chat messages.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cardTopOffset-Hint: Adds additional top margin for some cards. (Only applies to Coffee Pub modules.)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cardTopMargin-Hint: Padding above chat content. (Only applies to Coffee Pub modules.)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cardBottomMargin-Hint: Padding below chat content. (Only applies to Coffee Pub modules.)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cardLeftMargin-Hint: Padding left of chat content. (Only applies to Coffee Pub modules.)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cardRightMargin-Hint: Padding right of chat content. (Only applies to Coffee Pub modules.)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.titlebarSpacing-Hint: Changes the spacing between the elements in the titlebar of windows. This change applies to all foundry module windows with titlebar icons. If other modules are changing titlebars, this could result in odd titlebar behaviors.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3JournalTools-Hint: Tools for upgrading actor and item links to compendium references.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableJournalTools-Hint: Add a Tools icon to journal windows for upgrading actor and item links to compendium references.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableJournalDoubleClick-Hint: Enable double-click to open journal entries
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1RunTheGame-Hint: Settings for running games, toolbars, chat, and gameplay features
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2Broadcast-Hint: Settings for streaming and recording your FoundryVTT sessions. Designate a broadcast user who will see a clean, UI-free view for streaming.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableBroadcast-Hint: Enable the broadcast feature. When enabled, the designated broadcast user will receive a special UI-free view suitable for streaming or recording.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastUserId-Hint: The user ID or name of the user who will serve as the cameraman for broadcasting. This user will see a clean view with UI hidden and automatic token following.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastHideInterfaceLeft-Hint: Hide the left UI section (navigation, players list) when in broadcast mode.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastHideInterfaceMiddle-Hint: Hide the middle UI section when in broadcast mode.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastHideInterfaceRight-Hint: Hide the right UI section when in broadcast mode.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastMode-Hint: Camera following mode for broadcast: Spectator (follow party tokens), Combat (follow current combatant), Manual (no automatic following).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastFollowDistanceThreshold-Hint: Minimum token movement (in grid units) required to trigger camera pan. Smaller values = more sensitive following.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastFollowThrottleMs-Hint: Minimum time (in milliseconds) between camera pan operations. Prevents excessive panning on rapid token movements.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastHideBackground-Hint: Hide the scene background image when in broadcast mode. Useful for cleaner streaming visuals.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastDefaultZoom-Hint: The baseline zoom level used for broadcast camera. Zoom offset sliders adjust relative to this level.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastSpectatorZoomOffsetSingle-Hint: Zoom offset when following a single party token. 0 = default zoom, -5 = zoom out 5x, +5 = zoom in 5x.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastSpectatorPartyBoxPadding-Hint: Percentage of padding around the party token bounding box when calculating auto-fit zoom for multiple tokens. Higher values = more zoomed out (more space around party).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.broadcastAnimationDuration-Hint: Duration of camera pan/zoom animations in milliseconds. Higher values = slower, smoother animations. Lower values = faster, snappier animations.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2CombatEnhancements-Hint: Enhancements and quality of lifeimprovements to the combat system.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.announceCombatStart-Hint: Post an announcement card to chat when combat begins. If using the Crier module, you don't need this enabled.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.announceNewRounds-Hint: Post an announcement card to chat when a new round begins. If using the Crier module, you don't need this enabled.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.announceCombatEnd-Hint: Post an announcement card to chat when combat ends. If using the Crier module, you don't need this enabled.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTrackerHideHealthBars-Hint: When enabled, the health bars of enemy combatants will be hidden from players in the combat tracker.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTrackerSetCurrentCombatant-Hint: Add an icon to each combatant that allows the GM to set them as the current combatant.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTrackerClearInitiative-Hint: Clear the initiative at the top of each round for all participants.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTrackerAutoSelectToken-Hint: Automatically select the token for the combatant whose turn it is when the turn changes.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTrackerSetFirstTurn-Hint: Set the first combatant as the current combatant at the start of the combat after all inititives have been rolled.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTrackerRollInitiativeNonPlayer-Hin: Roll initiative for all NPCs automatically each round.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTrackerRollInitiativePlayer-Hint: Roll initiative for player characters automatically each round.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.clearTargetsAfterTurn-Hint: Automatically clear all targets when the turn changes in combat.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTrackerAddInitiative-Hint: When an NPC is added to the combat tracker mid combat, determine what happens to their initiative and combat tracker position.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3CombatMenubar-Hint: Settings for the combat menubar that appears at the top of foundry's interface.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.menubarCombatSize-Hint: The verticle size of the combat menubar.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.menubarCombatHideHealthBars-Hint: When enabled, the health bars of enemy combatants will be hidden from players in the combat menubar.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2Statistics-Hint: Settings for tracking and sharing combat statistics.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.trackPlayerStats-Hint: Enable tracking and reporting of player statistics (hits, misses, damage, healing, etc.)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.trackCombatStats-Hint: Enable tracking and reporting of combat round statistics (turn durations, timer expirations, etc.)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.shareCombatStats-Hint: If enabled, combat statistics will be shared to all players. If disabled, only the GM will see them.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.showRoundSummary-Hint: Show a combat round summary with key metrics like turn duration, planning duration, accuracy, and other measures.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.showRoundMVP-Hint: Share the combat round MVP, highlighting the best performer of the round, in the chat at the end of the round.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.showNotableMoments-Hint: Share the combat notable moments in the chat at the end of the round.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.showPartyBreakdown-Hint: Share a detailed breakdown of each party member's performance in the chat at the end of the round.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.showCombatSummary-Hint: Show a combat round summary with key metrics like turn duration, planning duration, accuracy, and other measures.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.showCombatMVP-Hint: Share the combat round MVP, highlighting the best performer of the round, in the chat at the end of the round.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.showCombatNotableMoments-Hint: Share the combat notable moments in the chat at the end of the round.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.showCombatPartyBreakdown-Hint: Share a detailed breakdown of each party member's performance in the chat at the end of the round.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3MVPTuning-Hint: Negative weight detract from the MVP score and positive weights add to the MVP score.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.mvpNormalizeByPartyMax-Label: Normalize MVP Scoring By Party Max
coffee-pub-blacksmith.mvpNormalizeByPartyMax-Hint: Score each category relative to the party leader for that round/combat (best value = 1.0). This reduces big-number bias (e.g. high-damage classes) and makes the sliders behave more consistently across different party levels.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2TokenEnhancements-Hint: Automation of token actions. This include token changes for when a character dies, is targeted, has the current turn in combat, etc.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.turnIndicatorCurrentBorderColor-Hint: Enter a hex color code for the border color of the turn indicator.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.turnIndicatorCurrentBackgroundColor-Hint: Enter a hex color code for the background color of the turn indicator.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2Timers-Hint: Blacksmith supports various timers for your game. This includes session timers, combat timers, and planning timers.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3GlobalTimerSettings-Hint: These settings will allow you to set the default timer settings for both the Combat and Planning timers. These settings do not affect the Session timer.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTimerGMOnly-Hint: When enabled, the timers will only be visible to the GM in the combat tracker
coffee-pub-blacksmith.timerNotificationOverride-Hint: Always show notifications to these actors (comma-separated names), even if notifications are disabled. This is useful for specific players that might need a more regular nudge.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3RoundTimer-Hint: This timer keeps track of the actual real-world round time.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.sessionTimerDefault-Hint: The default duration of the session. (Up to 10 hours, for you maniacs.)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3PlanningTimer-Hint: At the start of each round, a planning timer will be displayed. This timer will allow the players to plan their actions for the round.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3CombatTimer-Hint: At the start of a player turn, a combat timer will be displayed under thier slot in the combat tracker. This timer will allow the players to track the time remaining for each turn.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTimerActivityStart-Hint: Automatically start the timer when the active combatant moves their token or takes any action (attack, heal, or roll)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTimerWarningMessage-Hint: Use {name} to insert current combatant name.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTimerCriticalMessage-Hint: Use {name} to insert current combatant name.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.combatTimerExpiredMessage-Hint: Use {name} to insert current combatant name.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1ManageContent-Hint: Tools for managing tokens, images, and content.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2ContentImports-Hint: Configurations for importing content into the game.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableEnhancedImageGuessing-Hint: Uses comprehensive synonym mapping to automatically select appropriate images for imported items based on their names and descriptions.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.narrativeUseCookies-Hint: If checked, the system will first attempt to pull data from cookies before using defaults.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultNarrativeFolder-Hint: Folder that should be used when creating new narratives. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.defaultJournalPageTitle-Hint: Title that should be used when creating new journal pages. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.narrativeDefaultImagePath-Hint: Full path to a custom image for narrative cards. Used if 'custom' is selected above. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2EncounterGenerator-Hint: These settings control default values for encounter templates.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.encounterFolder-Hint: Folder in which to add actors when deloying from the journal. Leave blank to put them in the root of the actor tab.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.encounterDefaultCardImage-Hint: Select the default image option for new encounter cards. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.encounterDefaultImagePath-Hint: Full path to a custom image for encounter cards. Used if 'custom' is selected above. (optional)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2CompendiumMapping-Hint: When we automate searching for things, we look in the compendiums first. This is where we will look for a match. They are in priority order and we stop looking when we find a match.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.searchWorldFirst-Hint: When enabled, will search for matches in the world before looking in compendiums. When disabled, will only search in the selected compendiums.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.searchWorldLast-Hint: When enabled, will search for for matches in the world after looking in compendiums if no results are found. When disabled, will not search world as a fallback.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1RollingAndProgression-Hint: Roll systems, XP distribution, and character progression
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2diceRollTool-Hint: Configure the Blacksmith roll tools and integrations
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3RequestRolls-Hint: Configure the request roll tool and its integrations with other modules.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.requestRollShowInFoundryToolbar-Hint: Show the request roll tool in the Foundry toolbar.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.requestRollShowInMenubar-Hint: Show the request roll tool in the menubar.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3diceRollSystem-Hint: Configure the unified roll system and its integrations with other modules.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.diceRollToolSystem-Hint: Set the system you wish to use when rolling from the chat card.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3diceRollToolIntegrations-Hint: Blacksmith Dice Rolls work with some other modules. Selecte the modules you wish to leverage. (They must be installed and enabled.)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.diceRollToolEnableDiceSoNice-Hint: Use Dice So Nice for animated dice rolls.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2XpDistribution-Hint: These settings control the automatic XP distribution system that triggers when combat ends.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableXpDistribution-Hint: Automatically show XP distribution window when combat ends.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.autoDistributeXp-Hint: Automatically distribute XP after combat without showing the distribution window.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.shareXpResults-Hint: If enabled, distribution results will be shared to all players. If disabled, only the GM will see them.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.xpCalculationMethod-Hint: Choose the method for calculating XP from monster CR.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.xpPartySizeHandling-Hint: How to handle XP distribution with varying party sizes.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3XpMultipliers-Hint: One size does not have to fit all. You can customize the multipliers for each resolution type to fit your needs, and adjust for the playstyle of your group.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1Automation-Hint: These setting add features like token image replacement, movement tools, and more.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2Tokens-Hint: Blacksmith can autmatically change the name of a dropped token, change the token image, change the style of the nameplate under the token, rotate a token, add sound to a token and many more things.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3TokenRotationOptions-Hint: Configure the options for token rotation on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableTokenRotation-Hint: Automatically rotate tokens to face the direction they move. Tokens with 'Lock Rotation' enabled will not be affected.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenRotationMinDistance-Hint: Minimum distance a token must move (in grid units) before it rotates to face the movement direction. Prevents tiny adjustments from causing unwanted rotation.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenRotationMode-Hint: Dertrmines which tokens should automatically face their movement direction.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3TokenMovementOptions-Hint: Configure the options for token movement on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementType-Hint: The current movement restriction type for all players
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementFollowDistanceThreshold-Hint: The number of tiles a token can be from the leader before it is considered too far away to be included in the Conga or Follow marching order. A best practice is to at least have as many tiles as the number of party tokens on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenSpacing-Hint: Number of grid spaces to maintain between tokens in formation
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3TokenMovementSounds-Hint: Configure audio feedback for token movement on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementSoundsEnabled-Hint: Play audio feedback when tokens are moved on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementSoundPlayer-Hint: Sound to play when player tokens are moved.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementSoundMonster-Hint: Sound to play when monster/NPC tokens are moved.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementSoundVolume-Hint: Volume level for movement sounds (0.0 = silent, 1.0 = full volume).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.movementSoundDistanceThreshold-Hint: Minimum distance in feet that a token must move to trigger a sound (1-50 feet).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2DeadTokens-Hint: When a player or crearture dies, they will be replaced with a 'dead' version of their token.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.deadTokenCreatureTypeFilter-Hint: Comma-separated creature types to apply dead tokens to for NPCs (leave empty for all). Example: humanoid,beast,dragon
coffee-pub-blacksmith.deadTokenImagePath-Hint: Full path to dead token image for NPCs/Monsters (applied immediately at 0 HP).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.deadTokenImagePathPC-Hint: Full path to dead token image for Player Characters (applied after 3 failed death saves).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2LootTokens-Hint: When a player or crearture dies, they will be replaced with a 'loot' version of their token.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenConvertDeadToLoot-Hint: Requires the module 'Item Piles' be installed and enabled.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenConvertDelay-Hint: How many seconds to wait before the loot is converted to a pile?
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenLootPileImage-Hint: Full path to loot token image (applied after token converted to loot pile).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenLootChatMessage-Hint: Send loot updates to the chat log.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenLootTableEpicOdds-Hint: Percentage chance that the epic loot table will be rolled. A value of 0 means it will never be rolled, a value of 1000 means it will always be rolled.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2DroppedTokens-Hint: When tokens are dropped on the canvas, several automations can take place including renaming the token, changing the token image or portrait, and setting tkane charateristics like rotation, scale, and more.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.unlockTokenRotation-Hint: Override Foundry's default 'lock rotation' setting for all new tokens. This will allow tokens to be rotated freely.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.disableTokenRing-Hint: Override Foundry's default 'enable ring' setting for all new tokens. This will disable the dynamic token ring display. Note: This setting only affects Foundry's ring system and will not remove rings that are part of the token image itself.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.setTokenScale-Hint: Set the default scale size for dropped tokens.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.setTokenImageFitMode-Hint: Set the image fit mode for dropped tokens. (default is Contain)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenNameFormat-Hint: Choose the format of token renaming so they read how you want them.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.ignoredTokens-Hint: Add any token names you want ignored when renaming tokens, separated by commas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.fuzzyMatch-Hint: If checked, if any part of the token contains the word it will be ignored. If unchecked, and exact match is required to ignore the token.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenNameTable-Hint: If using a random name from a table, select the table that should be used to rename the token.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.nameplateFontSize-Hint: Sets the fontsize for nameplates under tokens. Range: 5px to 70px. Default: 24px.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.nameplateFontFamily-Hint: Sets the font for nameplates under tokens. Default: Signika.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.nameplateColor-Hint: Sets the font color for nameplates under tokens. Default: #FFFFFF.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.nameplateOutlineSize-Hint: Sets the outline size for nameplates under tokens. Default: 2px.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.nameplateOutlineColor-Hint: Sets the outline color for nameplates under tokens. Default: #111111.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2TokenImagePortraitReplacement-H: When tokens are dropped on the canvas, this module will automatically replace the token image with the best matching image from the cache.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementCategoryStyle-Hint: Choose how category filters are displayed in the Token Image Replacement window. Buttons show as clickable buttons, Tabs show as traditional tab interface.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3TokenImageReplacementDataWeight: The weighting for the data used to calculate the best match for a token and portrait image replacement.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementThreshold-Hint: How strict the matching algorithm should be. Lower values = more fuzzy matching, higher values = more exact matching.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementFuzzySearch-Hint: When enabled, searches for individual words independently. When disabled, searches for exact string matches.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementVariability-Hint: When enabled, tokens will randomly select from all images with the highest matching score instead of always using the same top match. This adds visual variety when multiple tokens of the same type are created.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3TokenImageReplacementCache-Hint: The cache is where we store the image references that are used for token image replacement. It also contains the tags, cateogries and other metadata for the images.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.numImageReplacementPaths-Hint: Number of image folders to scan for token images (0-15). Folders are checked in priority order. You must save to see the new folder selections below.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementIgnoredFolders-Hint: Comma-separated list of folder names to ignore when scanning for token images. These folders will be completely skipped during the scan process. Examples: _gsdata_, .DS_Store
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementAutoUpdate-Hint: Monitor the image folder for changes and update the cache accordingly. (experimental)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementDeprioritizedWords-: Comma-separated list of words that should reduce the match score of images containing them.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.tokenImageReplacementIgnoredWords-Hint: Comma-separated list of patterns to completely exclude files from cache. Supports the * wildcard.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3PortraitImageReplacement-Hint: Automatically replace actor portrait images based on matching criteria.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.portraitImageReplacementEnabled-Hint: Enable the portrait image replacement features and functions.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.portraitImageReplacementUpdateDropped-Hi: When enabled, actor portraits will be automatically updated with the best matching portrait when tokens are created on the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.portraitImageReplacementThreshold-Hint: How strict the matching algorithm should be for portrait images. Lower values = more fuzzy matching, higher values = more exact matching.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.portraitImageReplacementFuzzySearch-Hint: When enabled, searches for individual words independently in portrait images. When disabled, searches for exact string matches.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.portraitImageReplacementVariability-Hint: When enabled, portraits will randomly select from all images with the highest matching score instead of always using the same top match. This adds visual variety when multiple actors of the same type are created.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.portraitImageReplacementSkipLinked-Hint: Do not replace portrait images for linked actors (usually player characters).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3PortraitImageReplacementCache-H: The cache is where we store the image references that are used for portrait image replacement. It also contains the tags, categories and other metadata for the images.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.numPortraitImageReplacementPaths-Hint: Number of image folders to scan for portrait images (0-15). Folders are checked in priority order. You must save to see the new folder selections below.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.portraitImageReplacementIgnoredFolders-H: Comma-separated list of folder names to ignore when scanning for portrait images. These folders will be completely skipped during the scan process. Examples: _gsdata_, .DS_Store
coffee-pub-blacksmith.portraitImageReplacementAutoUpdate-Hint: If enabled, the module will monitor the image folder for changes and update the cache accordingly. If disabled, the module will only update the cache when the 'Update Images' button is clicked.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.portraitImageReplacementDeprioritizedWor: Comma-separated list of words that should reduce the match score of images containing them. Use this to prefer base creature types over specialized variants (e.g., 'spirit,ghost,undead,shadow').
coffee-pub-blacksmith.portraitImageReplacementIgnoredWords-Hin: Comma-separated list of patterns to completely exclude files from cache. Supports wildcards: 'spirit' (exact), '*spirit' (ends with), 'spirit*' (starts with), '*spirit*' (contains), '*.png' (extension). Files matching any pattern will not be scanned or cached.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH2AutomatedEncounters-Hint: A toolbar can be added to journal entries with potential encounter data. It provides tools for deploying monsters, calcualtating real-time CR, and creating combat encounters.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableEncounterContentScanning-Hint: Scan journal content for encounter data in JSON, markdown, or plain text formats when structured data is not found.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableJournalEncounterToolbarRealTimeUpd: Automatically update monster and party CR values in encounter toolbars when tokens are added, moved, or removed from the canvas. Disable if you experience performance issues.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.encounterToolbarDeploymentPattern-Hint: Choose how monsters should be arranged when deployed from an encounter journal entry by clicking the canvas.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.encounterToolbarDeploymentHidden-Hint: Deploy the tokens to the canvas in the hidden state.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1ArtificialIntelligence-Hint: If you want to leverage Blacksmith tools like Ask the Regent, you'll need to set up an OpenAI account and API key.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIMacro-Hint: The name of the macro that should trigger the AI window if you want one in addition to the Ask the Regent button in the toolbar.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIAPIKey-Hint: API key from OpenAI. Get yours at https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys .
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIProjectId-Hint: Optional: OpenAI Project ID for better cost tracking and team management. Get yours at https://platform.openai.com/projects
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIModel-Hint: Version of the OpenAI model to use. GPT-4 Turbo is recommended for D&D content but costs more. Free accounts can use GPT-3.5 Turbo.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIGameSystems-Hint: Optimize logic for the game system. Includes a default prompt that can be overridden below.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIPrompt-Hint: Overrides prompt for the game system above. Edit the prompt to customize or refine OpenAI behavior.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAIContextLength-Hint: Number of messages, including replies, OpenAI has access to. Increases API usage cost. Context is not shared among users and resets on page reload.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.openAITemperature-Hint: Controls randomness in responses (0-2). Higher values make output more creative but less focused. Default: 1
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH1DeveloperTools-Hint: Debug settings, console options, and developer tools
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cssTransition-Hint: Ease the new css styles into place with a smooth transition
coffee-pub-blacksmith.cssDarkMode-Hint: Enable dark mode for the css editor
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3PerformanceMenubarOptions-Hint: Show performance tools in the menubar.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.menubarShowSettings-Hint: Show the settings tool in the menubar left zone.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.menubarShowRefresh-Hint: Show the refresh tool in the menubar left zone.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.menubarShowPerformance-Hint: Show the performance monitor tool in the menubar left zone.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.menubarPerformancePollInterval-Hint: The interval in seconds between performance monitor data updates. Default: 5 seconds. (5 to 300 seconds)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.headingH3Latency-Hint: Settings related to the system latency between players and the server.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.enableLatency-Hint: If checked, the system latency will be checked and displayed in the system list.
coffee-pub-blacksmith.latencyCheckInterval-Hint: The interval in seconds between latency checks. Default: 30 seconds. (0 to disable)
coffee-pub-blacksmith.globalFancyConsole-Hint: You love sunshine and lollipops. Display console messages in rich colors... not that you should ever have to see them. Default: On (checked).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.globalDebugMode-Hint: Log errors to the console and notification system as appropriate. Make the console bleed. Default: Off (unchecked).
coffee-pub-blacksmith.globalConsoleDebugStyle-Hint: Looking for debug code? You have to ask yourself if you use the console to solve problems or if you enjoy a good word-search puzzle. Default: Fancy Pants.
